body:
0854
Drinking my coffee, hanging out with the pups and finishing the last couple things before I jump in the shower and hit the road. Tow company is coming tomorrow to take my Jeep for the Make a Wish foundation. Had some good adventures in that thing. Hope it‚Äôll bring a little help to the foundation.

Heading to La Pine/Deschutes area for camping tonight. Should be an easy 220 mile trek with good weather and decent camping options. Still undecided for tomorrow night. So many options around the Shasta area. Need to figure out my non-I5 route through northern Cali. The adventure begins :)

1708
Camp is setup. Made it to my target, Fall River CG. Have the entire place to myself. Right next to the lazy river. Little bit of occasional road noise, but not bad. Figure it‚Äôll quiet down later.

Running into La Pine now to get supplies. Firewood, water, dinner, and whiskey.

2136
Tired as hell. Didn‚Äôt eat enough this morning and felt it. Scarfed down a small pizza at Ponderosa Pizza north of La Pine for dinner (saved a slice for breakfast). Town has some rough edges, but decent vibes. Lots of Harleys and Gold Wings out. Only saw one KLR, on the back roads.

Was able to scavenge wood for a decent fire. Must have cleared some trees at the campground, leaving a bunch of downed scraps. Broke down pretty easily. Those Vaseline cotton balls are as good as advertised. Popped two inside a teepee formation with a little base and had a strong fire in five minutes.

Heading into Cali tomorrow. Have a few potential camp spots targeted east of Mount Shasta, but am going to stop in Klamath Falls to get some WiFi, lunch, and a better look.

Felt a huge difference riding when my blood sugar and hydration levels were up. Need to keep on that. Bought a gallon of water for my hydration pack. And will be eating a good breakfast of leftover pizza, granola bars, and coffee.

Stoked to hear everyone is loving the map/site I built. Have a couple ideas for improvements I‚Äôm going to work on during my motel stay this weekend. Better segment days and include these journal entries somehow.

Fire is about dead and my sleeping bag sounds better than ever. Will keep chasing the road in the morning ‚úåüèª

1339
Made it to Klamath Falls. Rewarding myself with a cheeseburger. Ran into a little wind and some thunderstorms coming into town. Gear and bike held up alright. Brain and body definitely needed a break.

Jumping back on Hwy 97, due south after I scarf this food down.

1728
Made it to McBride Springs CG. Sites are a tad close, and there is some light road noise, but it‚Äôs only 10 minutes from town. And I have my own view of Mt Shasta üòç

2026
Fire is up and going. Made some deer friends earlier at my campsite. Had to pay damn $8.50 for a shit bundle of wood from Ace Hardware. But at least I got some. Got there at 5:59pm, they close at 6pm üò¨. I should have just foraged. But too tired and thought I deserved a California treat.

Top Ramen and cheese-its for dinner. Snickers for desert. Trying to take this ‚Äúbear country‚Äù thing seriously. Cleaned out all my cookware away from my site and will be storing it in my panniers. Can‚Äôt imagine one would stroll into a 15 site campsite right off a somewhat main road, but ya never know.

Also screwed up and didn‚Äôt realize they had pump water at the CG. Went and spent $1 on a 2L bottle ü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è. Need to make a checklist for when I‚Äôm tired as hell and can‚Äôt think of anything other than keeping my bike upright and moving forward.

Looking forward to sleeping in a bit tomorrow. Going to do a light hike after coffee and then head into town to figure out how to avoid the Memorial Day cluster.

0855
Beautiful morning. Can finally start to see Mount Shasta a bit better. Instead of a hike today, the plan is to run down to Susanville and crash in a motel tonight. Tomorrow‚Äôs storm looks like the real deal, with an inch predicted everyone around here. Figure I‚Äôll get a shower, relax tomorrow morning and hopefully make a run for a campsite after lunch. If it‚Äôs not pouring sideways üòï.

Worst case scenario, I stay two nights in Susanville (only $65/night) and hit the road hard on Saturday morning. Not the end of the world, especially with the holiday weekend traffic/crazies coming out. Might as well bunker down a bit versus fighting people for decent campsites.

1313
At Burney Falls, some memorial state park. Pretty par for the course, except the waterfalls are the real deal. You‚Äôre able to walk right down damn near under em. And today there was only a handful of other people. If I didn‚Äôt have to ride another 90 minutes I would have jumped in. The 1.5 miles loop back trail was pretty decent too.

Just had a sandwich from the general store here. Decent people, but somehow didn‚Äôt know how to make a damn sandwich haha. $9 on top of that. Skipped the Clif bars, they wanted $3.75 for one! Thankfully Red Bull was normal price. Need that caffeine to push me into Susanville.

Hoping the wind isn‚Äôt too crazy getting out of here. Not fun stuck behind a semi going 65 with side gusts for an hour straight. Survive and advance.

2003
Lassen Ale Works might have the best fish and chips I‚Äôve ever had. And their fried pickles are no joke. Was surprised to find it almost full on a Thursday night.

Motel is perfect for $65/night. Got my bike under the awning, AC pumping, and good hot shower pressure. Glad I made the call to push through to Susanville.

Likely be going to sleep early and sleeping in. They have good dark curtains and a decent bed. No clue what tomorrow holds. Will figure it out in the morning ‚úåüèª

1031
Pouring rain all night and morning. Flood alerts for the area üòî. Supposed to calm down around noon in Susanville and south of here.

Plan is now to run down to Walker, CA and jump in another motel for the night. Not super stoked, but with the incoming holiday traffic and this heavy rain, I figure a 150 mile day is good enough.

Hopefully all my waterproof stuff is actually waterproof üòÅ.

1934
Made it to Walker in one piece. The wind was cooking all down 395 and into Reno. Tried jumping on 580, but got one wind blast with 4 lanes of traffic going 85mph and was off the next exit. Meandered my way south the long way, ultimately getting back on 395, fighting wind the whole way.

Dinner at Mountain View BBQ here in Walker was legit. BBQ brisket sandwich with pickles and grilled onions. This little highway town has some charm to it. Couple cool vintage-y motels and multiple weird flea market/random shit shops. Like a wide variety of metal dinosaur sculptures.

Met a friendly Aussie (aren‚Äôt they all?), Gino, at Hallelujah Junction up 395 before Reno. Was riding a pretty Africa Twin, all loaded up, headed north. Showed me recent pictures of his runs across Sonora and Tioga passes, and his work in progress Butler map. I told him not to split too many lanes up in Oregon or Washington. He‚Äôs headed to meet his wife in Seattle and then running up to Alaska. Might have to do that next year.

Going to drink my two Coors Lights I paid way too much for on this comfy bed and watch some sports. Either going to run Sonora or Tioga pass tomorrow and try to score an easy campground. Think it‚Äôs about time for a real rest day üò¨

0926
Best sleep I‚Äôve had yet. Bed was super comfy. Woke up and decided to make a quick run to a campsite 30 mins south of here. Figure I should try and snag something early today, then go explore. Don‚Äôt want to get stuck on Sonora Pass with no camping options and have to run into town somewhere.

Grabbing some gas and then heading out. Crossing my fingers I‚Äôll find a decent spot. Just gotta ride out the weekend warriors, then I‚Äôll have Yosemite to myself üôÇ

1538
Found a decent spot üôÇ. Was aiming for Obsidian CG, right off 395 past Sonora Junction. Only a ~35 min ride from Walker. Made it up to the campground by 11, but was already almost full, no view, and gnarly rocky roads in and out. Overweight Karen did not like. But, on the way in I noticed a couple pull offs with great views of the mountains. Backtracked a bit and found one that‚Äôs just about perfect. Little close to the road, but about one car an hour so far today. And the openness and views are amaaaazing.

After I setup camp, I ran down into Bridgeport for supplies and food. Had a super good burger at The Barn right downtown. And their fries were on the money.

Made my way back to camp and caught a rain shower right as I was getting close. Pulled everything in the tent and gave Karen her tarp. Really really glad I brought the two person tent. Fits all my stuff easily with plenty of room for moving around.

Now I‚Äôm kicking back and getting the rest day I‚Äôve been putting off for the last two days. Could lay here for hours listening to the rain hit my tent and the birds chirping. I‚Äôm a happy camper.

0825
Little chilly last night. Dropped down close to freezing. Stayed decently warm though. No real troubles sleeping.

Just made a little fire and drinking a big cup of coffee. Plan is to do Sonora Pass and try and find a campsite on the west end. Seems like there are a few options. Hopefully find something üò¨

After that, thinking about hitting Yosemite first thing Monday morning, or if I find a good campsite, wait it out a night and hit it Tuesday. Got some miles to make up after that though.

1410
Found a place to camp. Tried looking at a couple campgrounds, but they were all absolutely packed and madhouses. So I wandered to a place I had saved from freecampsites.net, down some forest/gravel roads. A big group has the best spot, but I was able to squeeze in down the road a bit.

Oh, and holy cow Sonora Pass is intense. Probably the most intense road I‚Äôve ever ridden. It was a straight hour and a half of hairpins, elevation ascents/descents, huge cliffs, and epic views. Was going to stop and get a selfie with Karen, but all the good pull off spots were packed üòï. Gotta say, the KLR held its own up there. Hit almost 10k feet, with a 3k incline within about 5 miles. Definitely was the least powered bike I saw up there haha.

Resting a bit, then jumping down to Sierra Village for supplies and something to eat. Hopefully jump on Tioga Pass tomorrow towards Yosemite üòÅ

1852
Made it to Nashville. Soooo much better than Memphis. Already got some hot chicken and a couple beers at the breweries. Happy camper.

Ride in was awesome. Took 100 east pretty much the whole way, which was filled with big sweeping curves, small towns, and great views nonstop. Made the 250+ mile trek worth it. Much easier to ride when you have a view and no semis on your ass or wind pushing you over. Tennessee is alright by me.

Spending an extra day here in Nashville. Going to explore a bit more tomorrow after I catch up on some sleep and energy. Think it‚Äôs been 4 days straight of 200+ mile days. But so so glad I got here. Good beer, good food, and decent people. Definitely avoiding the hustle and bustle tonight though. That king size bed is starting to sound pretty nice haha.

Plan next is to wander into the forest and camp a couple days, until I get into Greenville for the weekend with family. Really looking forward to that. And I know Karen is too. Gonna get her oil changed, filter cleaned, chain cleaned, full wash. Bout needs it at this point. Was complaining a bit today coming up and down over the hills. She‚Äôll be alright though.

0934
So, plan is to take off in a bit and try to find a site just west of Yosemite NP. Looks like there are a couple dispersed options. Then, I‚Äôll take all day Tuesday to go explore the valley and all that. Do a real slow scenic ride. On Wednesday, I‚Äôll take off first thing in the morning and get over Tioga Pass. Depending on fatigue, will either camp or Motel 6 it down in Mammoth Lakes area. Decent options for both, especially on a Wednesday.

That‚Äôs the tentative plan at least üôÇ. Figured I can‚Äôt miss Yosemite being this close to it. Who knows if I‚Äôll ever be able to do it like this again.

1504
Success! Found an awesome dispersed spot off Hardin Flat Rd, only about a mile from Yosemite Park entrance üòÅ. Decent shade and right next to Soldier Creek. Easy in and out from 120. Should be able to get into the park by 7 or 8 tomorrow.

Coming up the west end of Tioga Pass was amaaazing. So many great incline twisties. Only got caught behind two slowpokes, but they let me pass pretty quickly. Doesn‚Äôt have the views like Sonora or the crazy intense hairpins (yet), but it was definitely my flavor. Excited to make the full run on Wednesday.

Saw hundreds of cars coming west on the pass today. Doesn‚Äôt look like many people decided to take Tuesday off. Got stuck in a little traffic coming off 108 (Sonora), but was able to eventually find a back way to 120 (Tioga). Glad I stopped and looked for another route. Google wasn‚Äôt going to tell me about it üòê.

Going to setup camp now and run up to the gas station to see what they have for supplies/food.

1618
Late first entry today. Been moving since 7. Got into Yosemite by about 830. Traffic wasn‚Äôt too bad at all.

And holy shit. That place is better than the ten thousand photos I‚Äôve seen of it. It feels like you‚Äôre in a prehistoric time or Bob Ross painting, minus the crazy four year olds screaming haha.

Came through and stopped at Tunnel View. Wasn‚Äôt too crowded. Chatted it up with an older hippy guy who seemed to want a friend haha. Nice guy though. Said he‚Äôs ridden the Alps on a KX75 back in the day. And now he wanders around in his Honda Odyssey, going to blues festivals and national parks all year. Doesn‚Äôt sound too bad.

When I got closer in to the lodge and everything, I was a bit overwhelmed with all the options. So I decided to run over to the Lower Falls area. Saw there were a couple easy to moderate hikes around there. Did the Lower Falls, which was more of a quick walk down a sidewalk haha. And then walked over to the Upper Falls trail and did that. Woo, that one was a bit harder haha. Could tell I was still a bit out of shape. Made it up to Columbia Rock and it was totally worth it. The view was absolutely breathtaking. Had a 270 degree view of the valley, from the falls side.

After I made my way down, I laid in the middle meadows area for a bit, before going to the food court for a deserved burger. Was meh. Glad to get out of that place. Even on a Tuesday afternoon, it was still crawling with the worst kind of tourists. Loud, rude, and messy.

Either way, I‚Äôm glad I made the trip. Couple days behind schedule, but meh. Just grabbed some gas (53mpg!) and water and beer, and heading back to camp to relax. Hitting Tioga Pass east in the morning, then heading south to Mammoth Lakes. Onward ‚úåüèª.

0838
Packing up and getting ready to head out. Should be a fun ride over Tioga. Get to see the valley one more time, then elevation climbs and twisties üòÅ.

Think I‚Äôm about ready for a shower. Going to try Sheridan (?) Creek CG first, right south of Mammoth Lakes. If it‚Äôs so-so, I‚Äôll grab a Motel 6 in town. Still deciding if I bee-line it for Nevada/Arizona tomorrow or hit King‚Äôs Canyon. Not sure if I can get in from the east though üòï. Will do some more research when I get service (hopefully) outside of the mountains.

2033
Tired as hell. Ended up at a weird Motel 6 in Mammoth.

Caught the first couple periods of the hockey game at a decent locals sports bar across the street. Burger was super good. Different shaped bun, spicy thousand island sauce, crispy lettuce.

Waiting for my laundry to finish up, then passing out (with ear plugs). Going to grab a breakfast sandwich early, ship back my camera (phone works fine), then head towards the desert. Found a real weird kitschy alien-themed trailer motel in the middle of the desert that has openings. 240 miles away, but think I can make it without too much trouble if I leave by 8am, before the wind and heat picks up. Then maybe wander over to Area 51 haha. Should be an interesting day üôÇ.

Worst case scenario (wind/fatigue), there‚Äôs a decent sized town about 130 miles out that has multiple options. Not sure I‚Äôll be camping much out in the desert. It‚Äôs already getting up to 110 degrees plus. I don‚Äôt know if Karen or I can handle that. Don‚Äôt need a heat stroke two weeks in.

If I make it to weird alien land tomorrow, I should be on track for the Grand Canyon by this weekend. We‚Äôll see how the crowds and heat are. Might have to make a one night run through there.

Here‚Äôs to hoping the wind stays calm tomorrow morning. It‚Äôs my least favorite thing at this point üòî. But we‚Äôll keep trucking along. Excited to see what this next week holds.

0746
Ugh. Wind is already gusting 30-40mph here in Mammoth Lakes, and there is a big wind advisory for the entire area I was supposed to ride today. Expected gusts 50mph+. Playing it safe and got another night here at Motel 6. Not stoked, but would rather be conservative. Supposed to drop down to barely any wind tomorrow morning.

Guess I‚Äôll wander around a bit today, and maybe work on my map site some more. Ugh.

0739
Packing up and heading out today. Due east from Mammoth Lakes into the desert, towards Tonopah, Nevada. Depending on wind fatigue, will with do an easy overnight camp outside Tonopah, or push through to the Rachel area. Excited to get back on the road üòÅ.

1934
Made it about 30 miles east of Tonopah. Camping in the NF right next to some abandoned mines about a mile north of 6, off a dirt/sand road. Probably the only human for 10-20 miles each way. Pretty much the middle of nowhere haha. Wind and road were pretty brutal as I got into town. Came out here and setup camp, then ran back into town for food and supplies.

Met a couple friendlies on the road today. Tons of Harley‚Äôs out. Was gorgeous coming over Benton Crossing, onto 120, then 95/6. Sweeping deserts backdropped with snow capped mountains, then immediately to miles of sagebrush and rolling hills and rock formations.

Plan tomorrow is to get further east. Possibly Saint George, or a bit northwest of it at a campground. Trying to time things so I can snag a prime spot on the North Rim on Monday. Have 3-4 backups just in case. Want to spend at least a day or two out there.

Excited for the stars tonight. Back to the road in the morning. Here‚Äôs to little wind and decent roads üçª.

0943
Moving a little slow this morning. Breaking down camp now. Going to shoot for Caliente, bit northwest of St George. Wind isn‚Äôt too crazy today, so should be a decent ride. Might stop in Rachel for food at the weird alien-themed motel/restaurant.

1806
Made my way to Caliente, at a state park just outside of town. Great setup and facilities. Nestled between sweeping rock formations with super clean bathrooms, cool pump water, and 25 cent showers! All for only $15/night and only 5 minutes from town. Super quiet, too. Only two RVs here besides myself on a Saturday night.

Was a tiring ride today. Didn‚Äôt get out of camp until almost 11, as I struggled to get my panniers hooked up. Until I realized I had a bungee cord blocking the way (30 minutes later) ü§¨. Did a hard 90 minute push to Rachel, Nevada for a quick break. A big biker party was already starting there, and I didn‚Äôt feel like hanging around and losing a day. Also my KLR probably doesn‚Äôt make enough noise for those guys haha. After that, ran down to Alamo for lunch. From there, cruised over here to Caliente. The wind wasn‚Äôt horrible, but wasn‚Äôt awesome either. Got whipped around a couple times by surprise north/south gusts, almost giving me whiplash. Can definitely tell I handle the wind much better when I‚Äôm not as fatigued. Didn‚Äôt help I got the early afternoon wind as well with the late start. Also they weren‚Äôt kidding when they said highway 6 was about the loneliest highway in America. Saw about 5 cars within a 100 mile run. Zero houses or towns. And about 5,000 cattle haha.

Getting up early to run into town for breakfast and to call my mom. My sister, Jessica, is having her baby!!! Hoping to catch them on FaceTime. Will be thinking of her tonight üôÇ. Then, might mingle over towards St George or further east to setup camp again before I get into the Grand Canyon on Monday/Tuesday. Woo!

0822
Things to remember: don‚Äôt get chicken from a truck stop in the middle of nowhere.

New nephew was born at 10:41am eastern time! So excited. Waiting for pictures now.

Camp was decent. Had some fiesta or something going on up at the day use area. Traffic running up and down the road until about 1030 at night. Other than that, no complaints. Was nice to actually have a decent flushing toilet this morning. Sure needed it.

In town now, getting coffee and figuring out what‚Äôs next. Current plan is to pack up soon and head towards Snow Canyon SP, outside St George in Utah. Looks absolutely gorgeous and has decent amenities. Going to be a hot one though. Temps up in the high 90s üòì.

From there, I‚Äôll scoot towards Grand Canyon tomorrow. Hoping I‚Äôll have enough stamina to make it out to the north rim overlook spot I‚Äôve been eyeballing. If not, I‚Äôll find something easier and get there on Tuesday.

1713
Holy cow. This place, Snow Canyon, is amazing. Giant, dramatic lava flows and deep red sandstone cliffs. My mouth was agape as soon as I took the turn onto the state park road.

Snagged a campsite tucked back against some of the sandstone cliffs. Not bad for $20, especially with it including free showers. Taking them up on that tonight. This 100 degree weather is not helping my already sweaty self.

Fun ride today. About 15 miles outside of Caliente, Google Maps put me on a dirt/sand/gravel road for 40 miles! At first I was dreading it a bit, but after I realized I could hold 40mph easy, it turned into fun. Dodging giant rocks the size of my head, climbing quick 30% grade hills, and realizing I was about 15 miles from anyone each direction. The KLR ate it up. Was finally glad I put the 50/50 tires on. Been doubting those on every highway, but they paid off today. Gripped the hell out of that road.

Once I got back on pavement, now in Utah, I stopped in town to get my bearings. And realized I‚Äôm in Mormon country on a Sunday haha. Gas stations were closed, roads empty, and a general sense of eeriness. Finally found a grocery market open outside of camp, where I helped myself to a pulled pork sandwich right out of the consumer-style slow cooker. Slammed it full and proceeded to scarf it down in less than 5 minutes. Not bad for a $5 sandwich.

Going to do a 2-mile hike once the sun calms down and the wind comes out to play. The park ranger lady said it has the best view, and starts right outside the campground. Stoked for that.

As far as tomorrow, not sure yet. Was thinking about either getting all the way to Jacob‚Äôs Lake, north of North Rim, and camping in the forest there. Or possibly see if I can snag a fancy campsite at Demotte, even closer. But, I‚Äôm also considering getting over to Zion NP and seeing if I can get anything there. I‚Äôm so damn close, and I‚Äôll probably regret not stopping. We‚Äôll see how the body feels in the morning. Think this shower at about 930 tonight will help üôÇ.

Oh, also, I broke 20k miles on the KLR! Bought it with 6.5k. Started the trip at 18,400. Almost up to 2k miles for the trip üòé.

0920
Tired today. Not quite sure what to do. Sounds like Zion is already packed full. And my spot in the Grand Canyon is 3+ hours away. Don‚Äôt think I‚Äôm quite up for that. Thinking I‚Äôll target Jacob Lake, about 45 miles north of the north rim. Couple dispersed spots and a good sized campground there. Sounds like there is a gas station and food as well.

Last night was meh. Everyone decided to show up at 9pm and make camp. Wish I would have grabbed one of the more remote sites. But I did sleep in a bit. This shade helped keep the sun out my tent.

Supposed to get back up to triple digits today. After this giant cup of coffee, I‚Äôm going to get my ass in gear and hit the road. Don‚Äôt want to be making miles this afternoon when it‚Äôs real hot.

1639
Still tired. Made it to Jacob Lake. Setup camp in the forest just outside ‚Äútown‚Äù. At the restaurant now, about to eat their Grand Bill Sandwich. Which I guess is some crazy bull patty with green chili‚Äôs and a bunch of other stuff on it. We‚Äôll see. Place seems kinda tourist trap-y. But nice to have supplies so close to camp. Hoping they sell whiskey in Arizona at the gas station üòú.

Crazy wind again today. Got a late start and paid for it. 30-40mph gusts across open desert. Kept under or right at the speed limit all day.

Plan is to hit the hay early, get up early, and get south towards the Grand Kahuna. Hike around there and explore all day. Hit the road on Wednesday. No idea what‚Äôs next üò¨.

Things to remember: the deep, burnt redness of the sandstone (aka petrified sand dunes, who knew) cliffs in Snow Canyon.

1309
Wow. This Grand Canyon thing is wow. The dramatic depth and overwhelming size is wild. Found a great 5 mile hike up to Cape Final. Only one out here. Well worth the hour drive in off the main road. Wouldn‚Äôt mind if the 30mph gusts calmed down though. My fear of heights and vertigo is kicking in haha.

Going to hike back and get to camp. Need to figure out what‚Äôs next. No clue besides going east üòÅ.

1910
Broke 2k miles! Karen is still kicking strong. Might get her a new rear tire, chain and sprockets here by Texas.

Relaxing at camp now, drinking this mediocre IPA from Durango, CO. Shoulda got the Deschutes they had.

Good day today. Bit windy all around, but only two or three oh shit gusts. Think I‚Äôm going to grab a motel in the reservation east of here tomorrow. Try and figure out the next week‚Äôs route. Lots of flat, hot road either direction. But without bucket list national parks in the immediate future, I should be able to make good miles.

Grand Canyon was good. Honestly it‚Äôs so damn big it‚Äôs overwhelming and a bit underwhelming at the same time. Lack of contrast maybe? Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I‚Äôm super glad I made it here. But I‚Äôd take Yose over the Grand any day. I still get goosebumps thinking about that first descent into Yosemite Valley. Don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll ever forget that feeling.

Gonna grab a light breakfast and extra coffee in the morning and hit the road hard. Different feeling as I come across two weeks now. Starting to relax a bit more, I think. Either way, looking forward to pushing forward üôÇ.

1959
Long day. Got camp packed up and on the road by 10. Lots of wind, rough highways, and semis. Ended up at a Motel 6 in Flagstaff. Had my first Freddy‚Äôs Steakburger. Damn it was good. Other than that, been relaxing and getting ready for tomorrow.

Made my way through the Navajo Reservation a bit today. Some of the expansive views and dramatic cliffs were breathtaking. But man, it‚Äôs got some rough edges. Felt like a third world country at times. Kinda bummed me out.

Plan is to hit the road by 6am, hopefully beating the wind. Get to Gallup, NM and crash in another $40 motel. Hoping to get east of Texas here fairly quickly. Not a ton of great camping options, especially with the heat already picking up (100+ everywhere).

1235
Beat the wind today! Got on the road by 645 and it was smooth sailing until about 10, when it started picking up. Ended up in Gallup, NM, at a cheap motel outside downtown. Easiest 200 mile day yet! Going to try and get up even earlier tomorrow to see if I can squeeze a 250 mile day in.

Heading out in a few to grab some lunch and wander around town a bit. Feeling good today üòÅ.

1654
Made it to Albuquerque. Decent ride in. Google had me take some...

1925
Man, this town is legit. Gonna stay through Saturday night now. Found 5 breweries within...

2017
Good signs. I like this place.

1344
Decided to grab another night here in The Querque. Ended up doing my own brew crawl around downtown. Man, they have some good beer here. Think my favorite was the Monk‚Äôs Ale, had a couple of those üôÇ. Favorite tap house is probably between Sidetrack and Boese Brothers. Decent beers too.

Ended up with tacos from Sister Bar before it got too crazy. Central Ave was definitely starting to fill up. Grabbed one more Monk‚Äôs Ale (ok maybe two) and scooted back to the motel and proceeded to instantly pass out by 9.

Got a good shower this morning and hiked over to Taqueria Mexican for a super good breakfast burrito. Then made my way to Marble Brewery for a beer and some good conversation. Now I‚Äôm back at Sidetrack getting some AC and an IPA in me.

Probably kill an hour or two here. Build up an appetite for some more green chili stuff. And also maybe a nap üò¥.

Plan is to jet tomorrow to Clovis, right on the border of New Mexico and Texas, for a night. Onward!

1519
Made it to Clovis, NM. Pulled about 250 miles today. Got a little warm and hit some wind before town, but wasn‚Äôt too bad. Going to take it easy tonight and try to hit the road early tomorrow and get another 250. Found a classy $40 motel with good AC and TV üòÅ. The fires have squashed about any chance of camping out here. Figure I‚Äôll just keep hustling east to get past this windy zone. Should calm down by Arkansas.

Not much going on in Clovis. Definitely some rough edges. Had my fun in Albuquerque the last two days, so I don‚Äôt mind getting back on the grind east. Likely find another cheap motel in a small west Texas town tomorrow üëçüèª.

1844
I stopped in Vaughn today, off highway 60, for a Red Bull and a snickers (great lunch). The lady who rang me up about made me cry. I asked her how she was doing, and she told me her recently passed husband used to always say ‚Äúfiiiine...sure‚Äù (or something along those lines). She said she had forgotten all about the way he used to say that, until now. She said he left a lot of good, fun memories. You could tell she really misses him. It really got to me. All the things in the world, all the places in the world, and the things you treasure most are the people you share those things and places with. Got hit with a little loneliness. More relaxing than anything. Keeps my mind from focusing on how far I‚Äôve gone and how much further I have. We‚Äôll see how it holds up over the next couple days.

The other big change was long overdue. Moved my backpack off my back and onto my rear rack. Little more wind drag and height behind me, but the freedom of movement and lack of constant shoulder/back pressure already seems like a huge improvement.

Still deciding on what‚Äôs next. Debating on whether to head to Devil‚Äôs Lake outside Madison, Wisconsin for a couple days of camping or get further west and do a quick motel. I‚Äôll decide in the morning üôÇ.
